messages.title: Introducing Joan Ruddock MP
messages.content: I am writing to introduce myself. ... If re-elected I will serve you with the same commitment and hard work that I do with all my constituents. ... During my time in parliament... As a shadow Home Office minister... I was the first full-time minister for women... In 2007 I became an environment minister... I am actively involved in the Copenhagen Climate Change talks...

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Introduced wide-ranging energy efficiency measures and actively involved in the Copenhagen Climate Change talks.
Champion for equal rights and an environmental campaigner.
Introduced two private members bills to tackle fly-tipping, focusing on tackling possible use of recyclable material and building local councils' authority.
Authored a report on racial attacks that led to the introduction of aggravated sentences and further anti-discrimination measures.
Focused on rights and representation for women and childcare provisions.

issues.environment: Introduced energy efficiency measures. Actively involved in Copenhagen Climate Change talks.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe I have been a champion for equal rights and an environmental campaigner all my life.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Lewisham Deptford
politicalExperience.achievements: Introduced measures against fly-tipping and racial attacks legislation. Became the first full-time minister for women, then environment minister and Minister of State for Energy and Climate Change.

contactInformation.address: Lewisham Deptford Labour Party, 2A Ostliffe Road, London, SE14 6EB

images.caption: Photo of Joan Ruddock MP with supporters

leaflet.additionalNotes: Other local candidate details listed: Damien Egan, Mike Harris, Stella Jeffrey for Lewisham Central Council. Steve Bullock for Mayor of Lewisham.
